Secure OTA Functionality
mcu » apollo330P

Detailed Description

Purpose: This module provides functions for secure over-the-air (OTA) update functionality on Apollo5 devices. It supports secure firmware updates, OTA descriptor management, and image validation for secure remote firmware updates and system maintenance.

Key Features

  1. Secure Updates: Secure over-the-air firmware update support.
  2. OTA Descriptor: Management of OTA descriptor structures.
  3. Image Validation: Secure image validation and verification.
  4. Flash Programming: Secure flash programming for updates.
  5. Status Monitoring: OTA status and progress monitoring.

Functionality

  • Initialize OTA functionality and descriptor management
  • Add new firmware images to OTA descriptor
  • Validate and verify firmware images
  • Handle secure flash programming operations
  • Monitor OTA status and progress

Usage

  1. Initialize OTA using am_hal_ota_init()
  2. Add firmware images with am_hal_ota_add()
  3. Monitor OTA status and progress
  4. Handle secure flash programming
  5. Validate firmware images as needed

Configuration

  • Flash Keys: Configure secure flash programming keys
  • OTA Descriptor: Set up OTA descriptor structures
  • Image Validation: Configure image validation parameters
  • Security: Set up secure update parameters

◆ AM_HAL_OTADESC_STATUS_MASK

#define AM_HAL_OTADESC_STATUS_MASK   0x0F000001

This batch is used as bitmask - more than one can be set - Used only for OTAPOINTER register status only bits 24, 25, 26, 27 can be used (expand to 30, 31 if needed)

◆ AM_IMAGE_MAGIC_CUST

#define AM_IMAGE_MAGIC_CUST ( x)
Value:
(((x) == AM_IMAGE_MAGIC_INFO0) || \
((x) == AM_IMAGE_MAGIC_SECURE) || \
((x) == AM_IMAGE_MAGIC_NONSECURE) || \
((x) == AM_IMAGE_MAGIC_DOWNLOAD) || \
((x) == AM_IMAGE_MAGIC_KEYREVOKE) || \
((x) == AM_IMAGE_MAGIC_OEM_CHAIN) || \
((x) == AM_IMAGE_MAGIC_CONTAINER) )

Function Documentation

◆ am_hal_get_ota_status()

uint32_t am_hal_get_ota_status ( uint32_t maxOta,
am_hal_ota_status_t * pStatus,
uint32_t * pOtaDescStatus )

Get Current OTA Descriptor state.

Parameters
maxOtaDetermines the size of the following buffer
pStatus- Return Parameter - populated by this function indicating the OTA status of various OTA's
pOtaDescStatus- Return Parameter - populated by this function indicating the overall OTA descriptor processin status

This will retrieve the current OTA status of various images added to the OTA descr

Returns
Returns AM_HAL_STATUS_SUCCESS on success

◆ am_hal_ota_add()

uint32_t am_hal_ota_add ( uint32_t ui32ProgamKey,
uint8_t imageMagic,
uint32_t * pImage )

Add a new image for OTA.

Adds a new image to the OTA Descriptor.

Parameters
ui32ProgamKey- The Flash programming key
imageMagicimage magic# identifying type of image being added to OTA descr
pImageshould point to the start of new image to be added to descr

This will program the next available entry in OTA descriptor. It will also set appropriate state in the OTA pointer register

Returns
Returns AM_HAL_STATUS_SUCCESS on success

◆ am_hal_ota_init()

uint32_t am_hal_ota_init ( uint32_t ui32ProgramKey,
am_hal_otadesc_t * pOtaDesc )

Initialize OTA state.

Initializes the OTA state. This should be called before doing any other operation

Parameters
ui32ProgramKey- The Flash programming key
pOtaDescshould be start of a flash page designated for OTA Descriptor

This call will erase the flash page, which will then be incrementally populated as OTA's are added. It will also initialize the OTAPOINTER to point to this descriptor, marking it as invalid at the same time

Returns
Returns AM_HAL_STATUS_SUCCESS on success
